modName: Please DO Stop the Music SCE
summary: Civil War combat music bug got you down? Stuck in a combat music loop? The BAT has come to save you!
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]PLEASE [i]DO[/i] STOP THE MUSIC[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/65163-1-1430165136.png[/img][/center]
[center][size=5]A simple, no frills way of taking care of those pesky bugs that results in an endless loop of the combat music.
[/size][/center]

[center][color=#cc0000][size=6][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/3339/?]Skyrim Special Edition version available HERE[/url][/b][/size][/color][/center]

[size=5]Skyrim's engine is a mess from 2002 that has been torn apart and stitched together several times like some kind of technological version of Frankenstein's monster. Sometimes, that engine shits the bed, and one of the results is the combat music getting stuck in a loop. You might have encountered it after The Battle For Whiterun (Defense of Whiterun if you're a filthy Imperial), and if you're like me, you might have banged your head against the wall because PLEASE STOP THE MUSIC FOR THE LOVE OF GOD!![/size]

[size=5]Ahem.[/size]

[size=5]This mod is a simple BAT file that uses console commands to kill the script that handles the combat music. It's safe, it's effective, and it's idiot-proof. No frills, no bells, just a fast and painless way to end the insanity.[/size]

[size=5]There are two files included in the download: one specific to the civil war music bug, and one for regular combat.[/size]

[size=5]Got any questions? Read the [/size][b][size=6][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50812/?]FAQ!

[/url][/size][/b][i]Endorsements make me happy, but comments make me even happier! Be sure to tell me if you like it.[/i]



[center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]REQUIREMENTS[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]

[size=4]1. The latest Skyrim patch (Version 1.9.32.0.8)

[/size]


[center][color=#b4a7d6][size=6][u][b]INSTALLATION[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]

[size=4]Step 1: Download the archive
Step 2: Open the archive with 7zip
Step 3: Drag and drop "stopcivilwar.txt" and "stopcombat.txt" into your Skyrim data folder

[color=#e06666]DO NOT USE ANY KIND OF MOD MANAGER TO INSTALL!

[/color][/size]

[size=6][center][color=#b4a7d6][u][b]HOW TO USE[/b][/u][/color][/center][/size]

[size=4]Obviously you don't need to activate it if you aren't currently experiencing the combat loop bug; you only run the file if you're currently experiencing it.[/size]

[size=5][u]If the bug is coming after a civil war battle...[/u][/size]

[size=4]Step 1: Press the "~" key to open the console[/size]
[size=4]Step 2: Type "bat stopcivilwar" and press enter[/size]
[size=4]Step 3: Sit tight and let the command do its job[/size]

[size=5][u]If the bug is coming after regular combat...[/u][/size]

[size=4]Step 1: Press the "~" key to open the console[/size]
[size=4]Step 2: Type "bat stopcombat" and press enter[/size]
[size=4]Step 3: Sit tight and let the command do its job

[/size]

[size=6][center][color=#b4a7d6][u][b]COMPATIBILITY[/b][/u][/color][/center][/size][size=4]Please DO Stop the Music is compatible with literally everything.

[/size]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=5][u]CHANGELOG[/u][/size][/color]

[color=#e06666]5/6/2016[/color] -[color=#93c47d] V 1.0[/color] - Initial release
